job_title: Admissions Counselor in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Everglades helped me relocate my life to state that I always wanted to live. My career for the last 3 years has been the best decision of my life. I have met some of the greatest person (mentor) in my career growth here. Everything has lived up or exceeded my expectations or more. My advice for people coming from out of state, take a chance if you love to help people, I promise you won't regret it.
cons: nothing to share at this point

job_title: Director of Student Services in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Great atmosphere, top tier online division leadership, team-work made the dream work, and motivationally driven. The best part is the online division VP, and the reason I even accepted the position - fair, straight forward, and uplifting. There is nothing like working with and for someone you admire and respect.
cons: No jean Fridays, working on Saturdays (but we understand it is for the students benefit).

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in West Palm Beach, FL
pros: Good hours, respectable facilities, good holidays.
cons: Pay isn't great, you will stagnate.

pros: Interaction with faculty, staff and students. Lectures are enjoyable. Great environment and freedom to develop programs beneficial for student learning.
cons: Still working on lowering health insurance, but met with HR who gave great suggestions.

pros: The staff at this campus works incredibly hard to meet (mostly unattainable) goals set by upper management. The students who you are able to connect to and assist in making their educational and career dreams a reality.
cons: Campus Vice President stated I was “putting her livelihood at risk” for requesting 1 PTO day. The PTO day I was requesting was a paid day off that they had required us to come into work on to call the same 180 people we called every single day (Veteran’s Day). We were also harassed by phone calls from management to come into work on our days off for “required overtime.” Roughly 50% of the people we were forced to contact had inquired to this university over 2 years prior, and had requested to not be called. Calling people and being yelled at/hung up on all day. While none of this is Everglades fault, I strongly suggest potential employees think about the type of leader they want in a job. The verbal abuse and manipulation I suffered at this job was not worth the minimal money they pay. No matter what the potential student’s hesitation is to starting school, even including extreme financial hardship/living in a car, you will still be expected to lie to them and push them into making an extremely important financial decision (starting school that costs 5x the amount of a community college).

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Boca Raton, FL
pros: I truly enjoy working at Everglades University! Great work/life balance and supportive management/team.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Good experience, beautiful office building
cons: It’s not unusual for managers to yell at employees, make everyone work weekends or holidays last minute as punishment, and the environment is very tense.

pros: Working as a team to achieve enrollment goals Helping people attain their higher learning goals. Working with a small team of dedicated professionals that all march in the same direction thanks to a strong leader. An environment that is encouraging, supportive, and collegial, we work hard but manage to have fun moments throughout the day. Your own office, with a door. It isn't cubicle country. Top pay rate per position when compared to national averages
cons: The temperature in the building makes some offices very cold. Buy a sweater.

pros: None whatsoever, do not walk away….RUN!!!
cons: Toxic work environment, the worst leadership I’ve ever encountered, pressure from management to enroll anyone who has a pulse, scam people and saddle them with student loan debt for made up degrees that they can’t find jobs for.

pros: Wonderful work environment where everyone works together as a team towards the same goal. Truly feels like a small work family. If you ever have any questions or are unsure how to do something, there is always someone there to help and teach you. It is also a very rewarding experience working alongside students and helping them make there dreams come true. Many students have put off going to school for a bit, and when they take that first step it is such a wonderful experience seeing how excited they are.
cons: Sometimes people may hang up on you, but does not happen often.

review_title: The revolving door was a red flag
job_title: Admissions Representative in Boca Raton, FL
pros: The salary was a pro, they paid higher than most
cons: The company did not seem to keep employees for more than 6 months. Management micromanaged and though they stressed professional, they were very unprofessional.

pros: I have worked at Everglades University Tampa location for over a year now. I started off as a part time receptionist and am now a full time administrative assistant to the Vice President. The potential to broaden your experience at working at Everglades is endless! I have learned so much about the inner workings of a University.
cons: Sometimes the hours are long

review_title: Great Job With a Few Caveats
pros: +Pay is largely competitive with other universities. +VP Dina Siganos and Dean of Admissions Dawn Carlson of the Tampa campus are amazing leaders to work for. +Faculty and ancillary support staff is awesome. +Speaking with prospective students over the phone once you could get someone to answer was a great experience. +Meeting with students on-campus was also rewarding. +Training and onboarding was rock solid and enjoyable.
cons: -Was only getting 2-3 new leads per day on average. -Had me mainly calling well-mined leads from the past several years. Lots of voicemails, not interested prospects, and getting hung up on. If you deal well with this mentally, you’ll do great here. -Your performance is hugely under a daily/weekly/monthly microscope by Corporate Leadership in Boca. It’s very much a “What have you done for me lately?” culture. -The schedule requires you to work two 11 AM-8 PM shifts each week plus a Saturday every 3-4 weeks. This position is ideal for individuals that don’t have young children. -The cost of getting a Bachelor’s degree here is about $109,000. The cost is outrageously high compared to other institutions. -This position has many parallels to selling cars at a car dealership.

pros: Nice building in Maitland FL, professional atmosphere. Instructors care about their students
cons: WAY overpriced. $80,000 for a degree in Business or Alternative Medicine? Even if you get a grant you'll owe $50K in loans for a $30K job.

pros: Team environment, true to student mission, floating holidays
cons: Not traditional school format, can be a learning curve

job_title: Director of Library Services in Orlando, FL
pros:
I've worked in library field for 23 years. There is no other environment that has provided for me the level of support to reach our library users than Everglades University. As Regional Director of Library Services, I work with administration from the Office Of the President, which include our President/CEO Kristi Mollis and our Vice President of Academic Affairs, Jared Bezet. As the immediate reference point person at the Orlando Campus, I work with local campus administration, which include my Campus Vice President, Timothy Dauber and our Dean of Academic Affairs, Mr. Charles Stuard. Whether it's immediate reference assistance at the local campus or expanding ideas across all of our Everglades University Campus Library Locations, I can always count on our Campus and Regional Administration Teams for support, direction, and perspective as we support students locally, regionally, and nationally (Online Division). 
 When the COVID-19 Pandemic first hit, President Mollis made an uncompromised commitment toward the preservation of library services. This commitment created a platform for our team to find new and innovative mediums to service our students during an unprecedented set of circumstances. It is because of this commitment, library services did not just survive, it thrived! 
 This is just one example of the student centric approach that represents the broader Everglades University Culture. I am proud to work here and I am proud of the work that we have achieved together. If you have a drive toward helping students and a will to collaborate with a team that shares that very passion, Everglades University is the ideal platform for playing a role in helping to turn the dreams of our students into a reality.
cons: There are no cons at this time

review_title: Everglades University - Tampa:  A Wonderful Work Environment
pros: The campus leadership at the EU Tampa location is professional and supportive. The atmosphere is one that makes it a joy to come to work each day. There is a true team mentality that provides a positive environment for students, faculty and staff alike.
cons: Benefits offered to part-time employees are limited.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: This university seeks the needs of their students. Providing small class sizes and the one on one attention for exceptional service. Students are known by name and students feel welcomed everyday. Very friendly environment. Love working here.
cons: No cons. It's been a joy being able to work with everyone in finding positive solutions that benefits our student growth!

job_title: Admissions Counselor in Boca Raton, FL
pros: We have an amazing leadership that is always willing to help and direct us in the right direction. I moved across country to take on a new role and have absolute no regrets. EU was the best decision of my life.
cons: I have none at the moment

job_title: Financial Aid Director in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Great team environment, great benefits. Everyone is growth driven and student-focused. Cross-training also provides you with additional knowledge outside of your job.
cons: Still requiring masks, but it's for everyone's safety - staff, faculty, and students.

review_title: Everglades University is the place to be!
job_title: Work Study Student in Tampa, FL
pros: My biggest joy of attending a University is having the pleasure to work behind the lines and getting an understanding how the organism that is Everglades University works. Not only are the administrative workers dependable and easy to get along with, but you can always tell that the students and their success are the top priority. I look forward to working along side this great University until my schooling is complete and I hope to someday return as a prospective teacher or even just as a friend visiting.
cons: The biggest downside i see is that someday I will have to leave the work study program to continue my journey as a student.

pros: The students are great but you really feel for the ones not on VA benefits who are taking out loans for a $100K bachelors degree. There is nothing good about the actual work environment.
cons: Excellent staff are hired then micromanaged into oblivion. Be prepared for Unrealistic expectations for workload and dealing with all the “trackers” one has to complete accounting for every second of the day on top of the actual job you’re hired to do. This place is a nightmare...if you aren’t a company “yes” man especially. Don’t even bother applying here.

job_title: Director of First Impressions in Boca Raton, FL
pros: A great place to work. Treated well by my boss and feel appreciated. I am proud of our university in that it is taking all precautions to keep the staff, instructors, and students safe from the virus. Everglades provides cutting edge programs and small class sizes to unsure you get maximum attention from your instructor. If your not here you really should be!!!
cons: I have no down side being a part of the EU team!!

review_title: A challenging fast pace work environment!
pros: I have been working at Everglades University for two years and three months, and it has been an enriching experience. It is a fast pace environment, but we have all the support we need. The staff is caring for the progress and success of the students. We love our students and strive to prepare them to be successful in their careers. Everglades is a great place to work.
cons: We need to have a cafeteria

pros: Everglades University provides practical degrees from subject matter expert‘s to support student success. It is a success that drives students into gainful employment in the careers they choose. Students become highly competitive in the marketplace because of the subject matter expert‘s also known as faculty provide.
cons: It is safe to say that most organizations have something negative to say. In this case there is none to think of beyond the Covid crisis that keeps a safe distance from students.

pros: Computer setup with 3 screens and pay
cons: Everything else not mention above

pros: Everglades University offers innovative programs taught by instructors with real world and industry experience. Class sizes are small which allows for critical thinking class discussions. The Tampa campus has a family atmosphere for both students and staff. Everglades also has a great work life balance for instructors.
cons: There are no cons in working here

review_title: Student Oriented University With a Great Team
job_title: Financial Aid Director in Sarasota, FL
pros: A University that truly cares for not only its students, but also its staff, administration and faculty. With competitive pay, PTO, holidays, 401k match, and the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of students this university is a wonderful place to build your career.
cons: No cons at this workplace

review_title: Great Learning Environment for Student and Staff Development  Opportunities
pros: The school's Program and Curriculum structures offer in-depth knowledge opportunities to students in a conducive atmosphere. It is great for both full-time and working students looking to create or establish a career path. Veterans are welcome!
cons: Not sure of any yet,

review_title: Fantastic University environment to work and study
job_title: Vice President in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Regionally Accredited, Not for Profit, Focused on Quality outcomes, Supportive of Employees and remained open during COVID to retain employees and students
cons: All positive at this time, nothing negative to report

pros: Everglades University Sarasota is a great place to work! The organization promotes a professional work environment centered around student success. This team is collaborative, efficient and a pleasure to work with.
cons: No Cons for Everglades University Sarasota.

pros: staff is friendly, it is great to interact with students
cons: focus is on getting students to apply, theirs lots of pressure, out of bound calls

pros: This a university that genuinely cares about the students and their success- not only in education but also afterwards in their career! There is flexible scheduling options for employees, which is nice if you have appts, etc.
cons: None that I can think of.

review_title: Provide real knowledge of the construction industry in the workplace.
pros: The administration provides online trainings to faculty to improve the way we bring knowledge to students.
cons: Need a Health Plan for the Faculty.

review_title: Excellent Team, Great Hours and Benefits
pros: The hours and benefits are excellent. The team is great and professional.
cons: no cons to talk about

pros:

cons:

 professors.

job_title: Admissions Representative in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Great schedule and accommodations for employees
cons: Talk time is tough to keep up, but with the busy schedule we meet the demand.

pros: team play work very hard and not a clock watcher
cons: I am hard on myself, I only want to strive do achieve my goals and advance

job_title: Admissions Counselor in Lake Oswego, OR
pros: friendly and supportive work environment
cons: Limited job opportunties and career advancement

job_title: Admissions Counselor in Boynton Beach, FL
pros: The salary was decent and negotiable.
cons: Horrible trainings, Bipolar Management Team, Spiteful Organization. 100% Sales Quotas Enforced.

pros: Place where students comes first. Great staff!

pros: EU offers benefits and 401k

pros: People who fake it until they make it. Many faces to meet and greet you with an evil agenda.
cons: This institution will never stabilize because of the constant turnover of leadership. Garbage in, garbage out. Population declining and will continue to decline due to the watered-down delivery of their product and constant chaos internally.

review_title: Growth Opportunities for hard workers in Sarasota
pros: Sarasota is a hard market to find a truly professional job but Everglades University is a good place if you are a hard worker.  I have been promoted twice in 4 years - have fully covered insurance benefits and enjoy my work with the students.   This is a campus where most of the administration has been promoted from within.  I really enjoy working with students that want to make a change in their lives.  Our work schedules are build around what is best for working students.  I knew when I started that this would not be a 9 to 5 job but I have never been asked to work Sunday and have always been able to take time off when I needed it.   I have been offered opportunities with other companies since starting at Everglades but I am glad that I have stayed where I am.
cons: This is a young school that is working hard to build its campuses and there may be stress in working toward that goal but any professional knows you have to work hard to get good results.

review_title: The best Institution to be a part of as a  Campus Security Officer
job_title: Campus Security Officer in Boca Raton, FL
pros: I  have been with EU for 7 months  now as campus security officer and I am very happy here. My security company (G4S) has assigned me to the most rewarding post location so far. President Mollis along with the Executive Team and VPs work really hard to provide a happy work environment for the staff and support for the students. The president along with  everyone else weather its' staff members, professors, or students treat me with respect and understanding. The president never stops, she is constantly on the go. She is a hard worker, team player, and very passionate about her work for the school. She is awesome.  Everyone respects one another and treat each other with tremendous amount of respect. I am so happy that i am fortunate enough to be part of this great team here at EU and i would not  want to be anywhere else.
cons: so far so good  for me, all is well.

review_title: The positive reviews on here are fake. FAKE, I tell you.
job_title: Academic Administrator/Faculty Member in Boca Raton, FL
pros: The cons outweigh the pros so much that there isn't much point in listing any. The location is convenient and there is a cool banyan tree in the parking lot. If you have no regard for the current state of the national post-secondary education system AND you have ethics with no boundaries when it comes to cheating students out of their future earnings, then this might be a great place for you.
cons: The school is run by greedy, socoipathic, paranoid control freaks who will do everything they can to make you push the boundaries of your ethics to their limits... and beyond. There is nothing, NOTHING more important to them than getting the next enrollment. Please be aware that the positive reviews on here are FAKE. I worked there for nearly a decade and can assure you that the negative reviews are completely honest... and not those of people with poor work ethic, as stated in one of the positive reviews. Ignore the false positives! Run away as fast as you can.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Everglades University is a great company to work for! The staff is fairly small and this creates good job security and allows you the opportunity to work hands on with your students day-to-day. There’s also a lot of opportunity for growth for those that will demonstrate competency and show they’re ambitious and eager for the challenge. I joined this company five years ago at an entry level position and am now directing my department. Individuals who are hardworking, customer service oriented, and all around team-players will thrive within these walls. The best part of the job is the feeling of making a difference and changing lives. The staff really cares about the students and works incredibly hard to help them overcome obstacles and achieve their educational goals!
cons: This may come as a shocker for some, but positions here require actual WORK. The company is big on deadlines and employees here work hard to meet them. It’s a fast paced environment, so if your work style is similar to that of a slug or a turtle, this is probably not for you.

pros: This Institution is a step up from other local competing colleges with their Leadership in the Tampa location. They are very professional, yet sincere in their warm demeanor! The way they treat their Adjuncts makes one want to continue being a part of their environment. Its simply a very positive setting and enjoyable to be an Instructor there!
cons: If I had to mention one, maybe the term or length of a course could be a little longer. But it is satisfactory. I just hate when a student has a dilemma, for example, like a health issue and is out for a week or two and they miss a lot of the course.

review_title: AWESOME place to be and grow!!!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: This University is a GREAT place to work. After five years of being there I have seen so many people grow personally and professionally. I was personally promoted and one of my team members was promoted to my old job. If you work hard it doesn't go unnoticed! Excited about our growing University especially when so many other schools are closing or downsizing. I am blessed to be part of the EU family and I look forward to what is to come in our future.
cons: Hard work is required! We are a small team so team members cannot just skate by without doing their work. Everyone depends on one another as a good team should.

job_title: Campus Manager in Boca Raton, FL
pros: I have been promoted after being with the company and working hard for a year and a half. The organization has been extremely fair to me and has really treated me great. Some days are harder than others as this is a very fast paced work environment and if you are not a hard worker, organized and able to multi-task this may not be a good fit. Also the University is growing and does promote within for those who actually work! If you slack off and have a sense of entitlement and do not work hard for your growth it will not come. Hard work is rewarded!
cons: If you are not a hard worker you will not be able to grow… The University is student focused.

review_title: Everglades University Promotes Student & Employee Growth
job_title: Director of Student Services in Boca Raton, FL
pros:
You are faced with many opportunities to challenge yourself and learn new things everyday.  Our VP has always welcomed new ideas to promote a healthy working environment, student growth as well as personal growth.  Her leadership continues to direct the campus in a positive direction.   

In 2016 I was fortunate enough to have been given the opportunity to take advantage of the company's TA.  I received my MBA allowing me the growth to be promoted to my current position.  Thank you always Dr. Petersson for all your encouragement, & President Mollis for the opportunity.  Go EU!
cons: Working environment is very fast paced and you must be able to work hard to stay focused.  There is a realistic expectation that everyone on the team should work hard to do their job and get it done. That isn't for everyone so you must stay committed and management is supportive in that.

pros: The best job I have ever had! If your dream is work with fellow staff and faculty who truly have a passion for helping their students succeed and enjoy working together towards a common goal then Everglades University is the place for you! The dedicated team at EU Sarasota is a joy to work with and the Faculty are amazing. Our students make us proud every day as we witness their dedication to pursuing their degrees while working and taking care of their families! How often in life can you say that you were lucky enough to help make the future a better place? We do that every day by helping students change their lives through the power of education!
cons: I don't have any cons.

review_title: RUN AWAY - They don't deserve any stars
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: None! they don't pay, they scream at you and they don't train.
cons: you name it it's a con!

review_title: Fast & Innovative Organization to work for...
job_title: Financial Aid Administrator in Boca Raton, FL
pros:
Everglades University gives employee the opportunity to learn, train and grow within the organization.  If you are willing to put forth the effort of learning, hard work and have a passion to help students change their lives. This is the place to work for.  It’s a University that you can grow and be successful in your career. Dynamic faculty and staff.. The University offers sophisticated programs that are design to meet the needs of today’s demanding market. 
“Change your thoughts and you change your world”.
by Norman Vincent Peale.
cons: It would me nice to have more options on health benefits

job_title: Security Officer in Boca Raton, FL
pros: I absolutely love working for Everglades University, the workplace culture doesn't get much better than Everglades. The students, staff and faculty are great people to work with, the short time that I've been here at Everglades I can only say great things so far. Everyone has been so welcoming since I've been here, Everglades is an awesome place to work in. President Mollis and her great Executive team along with her VPs are so passionate about the work they do here, they genuinely care about their employees and faculty. In short I love it here and Everglades I wouldn't want to be anywhere else.
cons: None at all I'm blessed to be working with a wonderful staff and faculty great environment and the students are great as well.

review_title: Innovative Education, Friendly Culture, Caring Staff and Faculty, Beautiful Office Environment
pros: If you want to go to work and feel fufilled every day knowing that you have helped change someone's life then Everglades University is the place for you! The staff and faculty really care about helping students achieve their full potential and it shows! We offer Innovative Programs and it is excting to be on the cutting edge of education. Exceptional co-workers, a beautiful office setting, competetive salary and benefits complete the package.
cons: There is never a dull moment on a college campus - which I really enjoy.

review_title: I do not recommend working here.
pros: The pros of working here are the people you meet.
cons:
While you may have been hired to do one thing, at some point all positions are required to stop what they were hired for to do Admissions calls to get old students to come back to school. You even get written up if you do not make a certain amount of dials per hour.  I did not know part of my responsibilities were going to include sales and a heavy volume of outbound calls.

Also, you will never be approved to take more than 5 consecutive days off for a vacation. So if you like to take long vacations, that will not happen here. 

There are black out periods every single month (a new set of students start every month).  Typically, the first two weeks of every month you cannot take time off. You must work 12-hour shifts once a month (the first day of the start, 8:30a to 8:00pm).

Lastly, they force employees to go on job websites like this to give positive reviews and then you have to send them proof of what you said.

review_title: I have been with Everglades University going on Five Years and I have enjoyed the Teamwork!
job_title: Administrative Support in Altamonte Springs, FL
pros: Working at Everglades University has many rewards, the best reward for me is making a difference in the lives of our students. I believe in Education, and the students who attend her have the best Instructors at their fingertips. The Staff always has an Open Door Policy. We work as a Team, this is what makes working here wonderful to me!
cons: The only challenge of working here for me has been seeing our students Graduate and move on. We have touched their lives and they have touched ours, my heart breaks seeing them go....

pros: I work at the Tampa campus. A few weeks ago I was honored to hear 4 students give impromptu testimonies about their experiences at our campus. They mentioned they were not the traditional students and yet here they were loving their studies and getting a college education, something  several had never dreamt possible. I realized at that moment that our school is unique and it can be the right fit for many who may have been unsuccessful at a traditional school.
cons: Although untraditional in many of the subjects and each classe being only 4 weeks, many students are surprised by the fast pace and the amount of work. Not sure if this a con, rather this is college.

review_title: Enjoyed the Culture and Team in Orlando - Great Place
pros: Life balance, good compensation, strong benefits, team work, student focused and a local leadership team that cares.  They listen, they will react.  They are firm but very understanding.  I would recommend this to anyone.  This was just not the right role for me, but they supported me.  In fact, they helped me find my next job.
cons: In admissions, you really need to be able to connect with people.  It requires not only good talking skills but great listening skills as well.  The job does not seem hard on the onset, but it is challenging and take focus.  It can be very rewarding if your are good at it.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Working for EU has really taught me a lot about my self and others. The staff is great, we are a well oiled machine lead by a dedicated and caring VP. That kind of leadership gives us the ability to ensure team effectiveness and provide the best  service to our current and future students! The faculty is top notch, all smart and devoted professionals in their field. We have the best students, the most passionate group of individuals I have ever met, it is inspiring to watch them succeed.
cons: Like any job, things can become frustrating.

review_title: I got my dream job at Everglades University
job_title: Campus Librarian in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Everglades University is a great employer. It's a wonderful warm inviting environment - the campus is beautiful and the facilities are great! I'm finally in the academic environment that I always dreamed I would be in helping students. The administration is positive and they really know how to treat you well and give you the freedom in your position to truly shine. Everybody seems to generally really like one another and they are always available to me to help me through since I am the new kid on the block. The smaller size of the University lets me have more individualized attention to students. Everglades University has truly been a pleasure and I am happy everyday here and wish I had this job 9 years ago when I fresh out of library school. I just love working at the Boca and Online Division campuses.
cons: At Everglades, students are the first priority and they have to have access to all staff on their first day of class. So, once a month, I have to work from 9:30am to 9:00pm, on the first start date of the term of classes. (classes start once a month)  I think the library should be open until atleast 10pm  because students are in classes at night from 6pm-10pm and we close at 9 on Mondays, Tuesday, and Wednesdays and students are still coming in at 9pm. On Wednesday and Fridays, we are open 10am - 7pm. Therefore, I wish I had one more librarian to help out with the hours. That extra hand would allow us to be open so that we could be open longer with a real librarian on duty at all hours. As the University grows that maybe a possibility. I envision a new EU library where it would be a brand new facility with a very large library with lots of study areas for the students and a testing center. Right now, we just have two tables in our small library. It is not easy trying to come up with cons are they are just what is expected of a professional librarian at Everglades University. I am so thankful to have a job and this place is a breath of fresh air for me.

pros: My experience here at Everglades University is one not to be forgotten. I’m currently going for my Bachelors in Alternative Medicine, the science track. I was tired of just thinking conventional medicine was the only form of healing so I did my research and fell in love with natural medicine. Many people don’t know or understand that pills and surgery are not the only way to treat the body. With herbs, rehab (mental/physical), mind/body/spirit healing, and other natural healing modalities, there is a better chance of longevity and quality of life. It’s not one way or the other, both forms of healing (conventional and alternative) should be used for optimal health.  I’m looking forward to graduation because that’s when life really starts. With this degree, I want to better myself and heal the lives of others by changing their circumstances in a more positive way. My goal is to become a Homeopathic Doctor, Doctor of Oriental Medicine (DOM), or open up my own line of natural products. Everglades University provides a great learning environment. I love how the classes aren’t too big, it allows for more individualized attention to their students. Since the classes are smaller here, the teacher has more time to focus on each student which has really helped my grades and GPA go up. The teachers and staff are always available to go the extra mile to help students in every way they can. I used to be terrified of public speaking and presenting in front of a group (even a group of 5 people) and I became stronger due to the support from all my fellow colleagues. Just by overcoming that obstacle, I developed self-confidence and made new friends. This university has taught me leadership skills that I can carry on with me throughout the rest of my life. This degree opens up many doors and opportunities, if it’s something you’re really passionate about.
cons: Every workplace has some flaws but at Everglades University there isn't much to say. The only thing I would say is that I wish tuition wasn't so costly. Other than that there is much to say about working here. I really like the staff and students.

pros: New leadership changes are refreshing.  Significant improvement over prior leaders that were dysfunctional and lacked commitment.  The university has a positive vibe, re-engaged culture and a positive outlook on the future.  Great additions with our recent Student Services Director and Financial Aid Director; not to mention the new hires in admissions.  Great to see a cohesive and functional team.  Fun to be at university again.
cons: Change is difficult and drives ambiguity.   However, it is needed.  Student population is small, but looking forward to the future.

job_title: Vice President Operations in Orlando, FL
pros: Great working relationships, flat organizational structure that allows your to operate quickly and with student's interests at heart, financially stable, strong benefits package, culture challenges you to make quality decisions and maximize your time so that you are effect in your role. Team dynamic is required for the university to be successful. Not an operation that thrives on siloed operations.
cons: Flat organizational structure can lead to micromanagement and limited voice at times. Requires an investment in relationship building to offset and course correct. Future growth opportunities are currently limited due to size.

pros:
Working at Everglades University has been the most rewarding experience of my career to date.  My Campus Vice President, Paul, and Dean, Dr. Rosie have always been supportive with regards to my professional growth and development.  
I am fortunate to work with a staff and faculty who are 100 percent committed to the success of our students.  Having effective leadership in our corner makes that commitment a whole lot easier.
cons: I cannot think of any at this time

pros: I have been a full-time employee of Everglades University for over 6 years.  I enjoy working here.  The staff and faculty are very supportive of each other.  We have a great team.  But, more importantly we are all very supportive of our students.  I like the fact that EU promotes within the company.   So your hard work and dedication does get noticed.
cons: It is a very fast pace environment.

pros: Strong salary compensation with a great benefits package that is retention based.  The campus leadership team is focused, supportive and has a vision for success.  The professors care about the students and have very strong credentials.  Very happy that I made the decision to join this organization
cons: The campus is headed in the right direction and very focused on culture and student centric behavior.  Prior leadership struggled to engage around culture and passion.  Very happy with the recent changes.  Significant leadership upgrades that are having a positive impact overall.

pros: If the CEO has to force people to self rank there is definitely a problem. This place is a short stick away from a disaster.  Yes, it is a sales job. Yes, they will fire you within a month if you don’t enroll. Yes, there open door policy is a joke. Just read all responses to negative reviews  and see how horrible they are at communicating. Yes, it is a very toxic environment Period! Find a real University with a good reputation to work for that appreciates their employees. Also, all university responses sound like a bad Jerry Springer self defense.
cons: It’s like the owner of this organization put his daughter in charge to “play school”. Really sad for students to get mislead into this. Keep playing “play school Kristi!”

pros: Everglades University is a great place to work! We have a highly-effective team that is passionate about educating students. In addition, the programs offered by the University are very unique and allow graduates to be competitive in the work-force.  It is highly rewarding to be part of this incredible organization!
cons: Sometimes the work-load can be very heavy, but it is rewarding.

pros: This is a University where I had received my Bachelors Degree in Alternative & Renewable Energy Management. For some reason I can not get pass this without having to fill this out to upload my resume.
cons: It is a University, good school

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: I have been working at Everglades University for almost five years. I have had the opportunity to work with an amazing team and I look forward to see the university grow! This is a fantastic university with small class sizes, and students enjoy the personal attention. I am proud to be a part of Everglades University.
cons: I do not have any cons at this time.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: My campus Vice President Dr. Petersson heard that Publix would be getting a delivery of water today because many stores are out of water because of the hurricane so she went out and picked of water for all of the employees that could not find water. What a great boss and a really kind hearted person. It's the people like her that makes this a great place to work . Thanks Dr.P
cons: No words at this time

review_title: The worst experience of my professional career.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Had a nice starting salary and was close to residency. The campus is in a nice location.
cons: This is the worst company to work for. Please save yourself the weeks or months it will take to figure this out. Worst turnover rate (my position has had at least 3 people since). Staff are miserable, terrible benefits, zero professionalism and ethics. One of them works at my current employer and another was a interview candidate. Both had the same awful experience with the Boca Raton campus.

pros: I enjoy working  at Everglades University because of the Great Staff, Faculty and the students that have started and Graduated with their degree. I have experienced and learned a lot in my 7 1/2 years. I am always up for a challenge and continue to be all I can be. Motto "Can Do".
cons: The only con I have is not being able to  take time off within the year before my new PTO rolls in.

job_title: Admissions Coordinator in Deerfield Beach, FL
pros: The online admissions team is great. Most of the DOA's are awesome. Fairly young environment. Overtime is a plus but performance is a must. Flexible schedule as long as it is not taken advantage of. Great teamwork in the online division admissions department.
cons: Unfortunately, it is a sales job where you have to meet an unrealistic goal. The tuition is overpriced and there are a lot of politics involved. Overtime is mandatory. Not an ideal family environment. The management departments are overwhelmed.

pros: The students come to this university because they are genuinely interested in advancing their knowledge in their chosen field.  Their passion and enthusiasm matched with the faculty expertise make the campus come alive!
cons: Many people still do not know about the university.  Once the word gets out, the student population will grow!  EU is a hidden treasure.

pros:
I have been working at Everglades University part-time (first term)

Pros

I have been only one term, but I love it. The organization has really treated me great. The Dean and all the staff have been very helpful. And the students are very easy to teach and participate during the class sessions.
cons:
Cons

None. So far everything has been great, so there are no cons at this time.

pros: Everglades University gave it's employees paid time off before the storm and after because they care about us.  The campus VP at the Sarasota campus also provided a hot meal for the students and staff everyday for the whole first week we were back.  What other company - let alone school did that!
cons: We work hard but it is appreciated.

pros: "Everglades University is a wonderful company to work for- very student focused. Several things worth pointing out is the overall atmosphere which allows the management team to easily help everyone get acquainted with the overall job feel. My fellow teammates have been wonderful helping me get set up in my area. The hiring process was wonderful and easily streamlined. All expectations were made clear throughout the entire process. I look forward to making a full career at Everglades University by achieving the expectations placed in front of me.”
cons: Haven't experienced any yet- too new!

pros: Friendly coworkers, great training program, everyone is extremely knowledage
cons: None that come to mind

job_title: Admission Counselor in Boca Raton, FL
pros: There are no Pros! DO NOT ENROLL AND DO NOT APPLY!!!
cons: I have worked for this company for over a year as an Admissions Counselor. I have had to do some of the most demeaning, deceitful things just to enroll students.  I have lied about the benefits of the programs. Promised them job opportunities for such off the wall programs such as Alternative Medicine or Alternative and Renewable energy. Lets get real!  You have people with Accounting and engineering degrees that can't get a job and you think these prospective students will get a job with these degrees! GET REAL! Upon approval of management I was directed to tell a student to ENROLL OR ELSE. This is a Heavy Sales position. Understand that! With that being said, no one wants to enroll to an unknown school for $8000.00 a semester for undergrad for approximately 11 semesters. That's almost $90,000.00 just for a bachelors degree. INSANE!!!!!!!  when well known community colleges cost 1/4th of that price. This school has no amenities. No Gym, no clubs no job opportunities. The classes are 1 month long. Imagine what you have learned in a class that you have taken all semester and condense that into 1 month. Now think quality of learning and retaining that material. Yeah Right!!!  My job was to threaten students to enroll, If not I would have been fired. The president Kristi Mollis and her subordinates threaten your job on a daily basis. They call you,email you and text you several times daily while you are making calls and with prospective students wanting to now if you have found another sucker! and wanted constant reports daily. This seriously slows down your daily progress of finding said sucker! The stress and fear you have on a daily basis of losing the job will erode you inside in ways you can only imagine in NIGHTMARES!!. I have deceived students to enroll just to keep a job. I HOPE GOD CAN FORGIVE ME as these students will be in debt up to their ears with a degree which is virtually useless, unless you run out of toilet paper at home. If some part of you is looking for a job  at Everglades University and you see this message. I hope you take this seriously. If i had a chance to speak to someone who was looking to get hired at Everglades University, I would tell them that not only is it better for them not to have a job, but that it would be better for them if they walked blindfolded, in reverse, into oncoming traffic!

job_title: Admissions Counselor in Boca Raton, FL
pros:
Clean, safe work environment 
Regular training opportunities
Computers were regularly updated
Reliable phone service available
Close to Tri-Rail transportation for those who don't live in Palm Beach County
cons:
Erratic leadership; annual hire up in the fall / downsize in the spring cycle
Weird / reliable water filtration system - safer to bring your own water / coffee than to use what was offered
Fair supervisors driven off by whimsical / fire them before they come after us leadership style

review_title: Great place to work... if you have no spine, morals or ambition
pros: It's impressive that the president is able to instill such fear in her managers that they all have to write bologna reviews about working at EU to boost their ratings...
cons:
Being idealistic and bright-eyed will not get you far at this place. They want spineless yes-men that will throw complete logic out the window when it comes to basic good business practices. Being creative and having new ideas is seen as rocking the boat and you won't go far. They'll stymie you, take away your overtime and make your life a living hell until you quit. 
No life/work balance. Working on Saturdays and Sundays and changing your schedule without any advanced notice... we had to work on Labor day last year without holiday pay... we even had to work on Christmas eve without holiday pay.
HIGH turnover (the staff has churned itself out at least twice in the past year... VPs, Deans, Department Chairs, you name it, they have all quit because that place is unbearable)
This place is going to lose its accreditation. They created a masters program and without even having teachers, books or classes, they SOLD it to students!!! They didn't even have an academic chair to help create the program because they ALL QUIT. Not to mention, they would have us change forms and add advising paperwork to files when the advising never happened. I was actually asked to sign a document that was dated 2 years before I worked there! SACS needs to wake up and take a good long look at this place and its practices. Save your reputation and DO NOT work here. They're going down in flames and they'll use you as a scapegoat.
DO NOT believe the positive reviews about EU. They were written by management and as you'll see from the previous reviews, management has no idea what they're doing. I've worked at gas stations that have better management than this place.

review_title: Is is possible to put 0 stars???
pros: This job is only good to use as a resume builder, if you need the experience stick it out for as long as you can tolerate, then use this experience to get a professional job that value their employees. My cons will explain why...
cons:
-Very poorly managed, Corporate is located within an actual Campus and they mainly operate on the word called pride. Being on campus, they torture their employees all day, and I mean they literally have offices in the mix of campus employees and actually work amoungst them as if they are wanted there.
-Corporate people treat and talk to you as if you are not human beings, no respect is given. They are not professionals at all! 
-They need much help in their training dept. as they do not properly train you, but yet expect perfection and slam you when you make a mistake. 
-There is a revolving door for certain positions, at some point they need to realize that the problem can't always be everyone else.
-Many are secretly dying to get out of there but are stuck b/c they have began taking classes and will have to refund all of their tuition reimburstment (which is like ($80K) if they quit within a certain time frame. Do not attend school there!
-Make sure you get a job before quitting there and tell the prospective employer not to contact your current one due to conflict of intesrest. Reson being, they will not give you a good reference just b/c you are quitting them. Again, Did I mention how disrespectful, unprofessional & prideful their Corporate team is?

review_title: You do not want to work here!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: There are certainly some good, hard-working people here. The students, staff and faculty are pros.  You bond together with good coworkers and then you support each other through the horrible, hypocritical management until you get through and support each other after you are all happily gone.  I have made life-long friends because difficult experiences tend to bond good people together.     The location is good.  Also, it appears that management has honed their skills in writing fake 5 star reviews that suddenly appear after a worker resigns that say exactly the opposite of what was written.  There is a lot of turnover, so management gets a lot of practice writing these fake reviews that are so unbelievable anyway.  “Go, team”!
cons: This place puts on a great show when they hire you and pretend that they are all about the students.  This is absolutely untrue.  Students only matter while they are being aggressively recruited or when they are being signed up for predatory loans.   Profit and numbers rule here and students who barely speak English are enrolled to make quotas.  Don’t be fooled, this is a business above all else.   There is very high turnover here and as soon as you start the façade falls away and you realize you are being disrespected daily in a sweat shop like atmosphere.  Extremely long days that go on and on with no break in sight.  You then have to deal with crazy demands of your time and energy while you look for your next job!  Most people do not last more than six months to a year.  You will be disrespected and lied to and in the end when you resign or get fired, you cannot even use this place as a reference.   This is a horrible place to work and I am happy to give this advice!  I wish I was warned, I had serious PTsd  after my tour here.  I would advise that you do a search on LinkedIn on former employees and ask them to share their thoughts.

review_title:
Horrible Horrible Horrible!!!!
Stay away unless you like to be treated like dog crap.
pros: Zero. Nothing there is no value to working at this education sink hole.  I feel badly for anyone that is deceived by the con artisty of the school.
cons:
Management has absolutely NO clue. Favoritism runs rampited.  This school is the negative armpit of what is wrong with for profit education.  The owner and adms make 100k+
Students will be strapped with 150k worth of loans! Outrageous!!

pros:
EU truly puts the best interest of the Student FIRST! 

The Miami campus has created an Environment for our Students to feel and know that we Care about their education and career advancement.

EU fosters a Work/Life Balance 

There is NO glass ceiling here, ONLY True potential to grow!
cons: The Reception needs more Chocolate please

pros: Amazing Staff, Faculty and Students.
cons: I have no Cons to share

pros: The Tampa campus is an amazing place to work. The staff is friendly and is really more of a family than coworkers. The students are unique and the faculty experts in their fields with a passion for teaching.
cons: It is VERY fast paced. You need to be a multitask-er and always on top of your responsibilities.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: There was nothing, except I got paid.
cons: The worst is the way they treat employees but then expect and even DEMAND complete loyalty to the point where you can't put your family first. They insist that you lie up here and post positive fake reviews... or else.  Management is a joke and they are clueless about running a real school.

review_title: Worst job ever! Don't believe the 5 star rating
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Nothing good but they pay a little more than average higher ed jobs
cons: It's by far the worse Job I currently have! The reviews are false. Trust me they are all made up by upper management to hide the truth and to boost they horrible rating. Please don't ever apply here because your life will be impacted! Worse management from top to bottom!

pros:
Administration is supportive of both faculty and students
Opportunities to teach mornings or evenings
Small class sizes make it easier to establish interpersonal relationships with students
cons: Classes run 12 hours a week for four weeks, which can be challenging if you're not accustomed to it

pros: Everglades University - Tampa focuses first and foremost on Student Success.
cons: During the COVID-19 pandemic, we have truly missed seeing our on-ground students.

pros:

The environment is warm and welcoming.

pros: The Tampa campus is like a family. The students are our number one concern. Our Vice President is very hands on and truly cares for each and every student.

pros: Excellent staff and faculty; most students worked hard and were happy to be there; great collegiality
